name: Frizzy
description: Frizzy is a platformer filled with awesome action. The main plot is that you are a frizzy ball of fur who can latch onto static balls launch himself around the levels.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 3 Ghz CPU Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 250 MB available space

reviews.review_text: 5.9/10 - Simple Platformer with Some Surprisingly Unique Gameplay.   This game is definitely influenced by the Nintendo Age; classic Mario coin collecting with a twist. This time you are collecting hearts throughout the map; once you collect enough you can move advance levels. (Not the twist)  The overall 'story' and main objective of collecting a ton of hearts doesn't really do it for me, but it's by no means a bad game. It's just more of a cute and extremely casual platformer. The graphics are fun and remind me of the Nintendo 64!  The gameplay really made me give this a positive review; as a little ball of fur you have to launch yourself via static electricity to greater heights in order to collect all of the required hearts. It really reminds me of portal but instead of going through the portals you are catapulted by them. I personally would have loved to focus on this element and puzzle objectives as opposed to monotonous collection of hearts.   It's worth $1-3; I wouldn't pay full price... but I don't like platformers.     Accidently Reviewed

This game is actually one of the best games ever, I believe that it is the HEIGHT of gaming, a true example of perfection.
